TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for classes that enable the server to gather information about the capabilities of the browser that made the current request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class enables you to create derived classes that are like the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper> class serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper> class to call members of the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser is capable of supporting ActiveX controls.
Docs.value: if the browser can support ActiveX controls; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the collection of available control adapters.
Docs.value: The registered control adapters for the browser.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddBrowser(string browserName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the browser to add.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, used internally to add an entry to the internal collection of browsers for which capabilities are recognized.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the client is an America Online (AOL) browser.
Docs.value: if the browser is an AOL browser; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports playing background sounds by using the HTML element.
Docs.value: if the browser supports playing background sounds; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser is a beta version.
Docs.value: if the browser is a beta version; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the browser string (if any) that was sent by the browser in the request header.
Docs.value: The contents of the request header that was sent by the browser.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a collection of browsers for which capabilities are recognized.
Docs.value: The browsers for which capabilities are recognized.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports decks that contain multiple forms, such as separate cards.
Docs.value: if the browser supports decks that contain multiple forms; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser device is capable of initiating a voice call.
Docs.value: if the browser device is capable of initiating a voice call; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports page content that follows WML or elements.
Docs.value: if the browser supports page content that follows HTML or elements; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports empty HTML elements.
Docs.value: if the browser supports empty HTML elements; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports WML and elements together in the same card.
Docs.value: if the browser supports WML and elements together; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports WML elements that specify both and attributes.
Docs.value: if the browser supports WML elements that specify both and attributes; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports WML and elements in the same card.
Docs.value: if the browser supports WML and elements in the same WML card; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports WML cards for postback.
Docs.value: if the browser supports WML cards for postback; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports WML elements that have a attribute of 0.
Docs.value: if the browser supports WML elements that have a attribute of 0; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports sending e-mail messages by using the HTML scheme.
Docs.value: if the browser supports sending e-mail message by using the HTML scheme; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.IDictionary Capabilities { get; set; }

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, used internally to get the defined capabilities of the browser.
Docs.value: The defined capabilities of the browser.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports Channel Definition Format (CDF) for webcasting.
Docs.value: if the browser supports CDF; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the version of the .NET Framework that is installed on the client.
Docs.value: The common language runtime (CLR) version.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int CompareFilters (string filter1, string filter2);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 CompareFilters(string filter1, string filter2) cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, used internally to compare filters.
Docs.returns: 1 if is a parent of ; -1 if is a parent of ; or 0 if there is no parent-child relationship between and .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser is capable of supporting cookies.
Docs.value:
if the browser can support cookies; otherwise, .
This property does not indicate whether cookies are currently enabled in the browser, only whether the browser can support cookies.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser is a search-engine Web crawler.
Docs.value: if the browser is a search-engine crawler; otherwise, .

Docs.returns: A new instance of the object.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the maximum number of submit buttons that are allowed for a form.
Docs.value: The maximum number of submit buttons that are allowed for a form.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, used internally to disable use of an optimized cache key.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the version number of ECMAScript (JavaScript) that the browser supports.
Docs.value: The version number of ECMAScript (JavaScript) that the browser supports.

Docs.returns: if the filter was successfully evaluated; otherwise, .

Docs.value: if the browser supports frames; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the fully qualified class name of the to use for writing markup characters and text.
Docs.value: The fully qualified class name of the to use for writing markup characters and text.

Docs.value: The type of input supported by the browser.

Docs.returns: if the client browser is the same as the specified browser; otherwise, .

Docs.value: if the browser is a recognized mobile device; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string this[string key] { get; }

Docs.param: The name of the browser capability to retrieve.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the value of the specified browser capability. In C#, this property is the indexer for the class.
Docs.value: The browser capability with the specified key name.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports Java.
Docs.value:
if the browser supports Java; otherwise, .
This property does not indicate whether Java is currently enabled in the browser, only whether the browser can support Java.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the JScript version that the browser supports.
Docs.value: The version of JScript that the browser supports.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For version number of ECMAScript supported by the browser, see <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase.EcmaScriptVersion%2A>.
